text: What better way to counter my denial of the cold season starting with a nice summer tune. Looking back, this game and its sequel were quite the unique and dark/depressing ride,  unlike anything I've played. Sure it gets some inspiration from some other games, but it's really its own thing. Interestingly, I remember seeing some tweets from the creator saying he actually hated Buddy/Lisa (the character) and regretted making the Joyful sequel, which was done because of a Kickstarter stretch goal before he even finished writing the story. As they say, you're often your harshest critic.
author: SupraDarky

text: Interesting to know, I also disliked Buddy, even though she has some interesting moments in the Joyful. But some things definitely make more sense knowing this.

text:
I'm not too crazy about the sequel, myself. Buddy inexplicably becomes an edgelord who wants to conquer the world and kills (or, at least is sorely tempted to kill) a bunch of pacifists and Lisa, the protagonist of the first game who we've been given intimate insights into the hellish abuse she's suffered at the hands of her father (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kb0YUvgBcVc), is suddenly revealed to have known Buzzo and she goaded him into mutilating small animals and cutting her with a buzzsaw. Okay... I don't remember any of that when I looked into every nook and cranny of her mind but I guess that's canon, now.


On the other hand, the fangames, Pointless and Hopeful, are magnificent.
